intro: Uragoga ituriensis, commonly known as the Ituri fern, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in the dense canopy. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine by local communities. Uragoga ituriensis plays a vital role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and contributing to the biodiversity of its native environment.
